intro: Orthostemma comorensis, commonly known as the Comorian orthostem, is a flowering plant belonging to the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to the Comoros archipelago in the Indian Ocean and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant features heart-shaped, glossy leaves and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink and white. It is often found growing in rocky or forested areas, where it benefits from well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
